A guided tour of Nehru’s intellectual archive with Professor Madhavan Palat
description:
What did Jawaharlal Nehru truly think about Indian civilisation, culture and religion? In this episode of Terms of Engagement, historian Professor Madhavan Palat editor of the Collected Works of Jawaharlal Nehru takes us inside Nehru’s writings and speeches. Together, we explore his views on caste, Islam, secularism, and how he imagined modern India, while also showing how anyone can navigate Nehru’s vast online archive for themselves.

Interview: Varghese K George

Fossil fuel peak demand pushed to 2030s as oil rebounds; India emerges as growth engine
description: Global oil demand reversed its predicted decline in 2025, with India emerging as a major consumption driver. This resurgence was fueled by delayed clean energy policies and geopolitical tensions, while India diversified its oil imports, notably from Russia, and expanded refining capacity. Stable oil prices provided fiscal relief for importers like India.

title: Hindu man lynched, body burnt in Bangladesh; 7 arrested
description: Seven arrests were made after a Hindu youth was beaten to death and his body set ablaze in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district following blasphemy allegations. The victim, Dipu Chandra Das, was accused of making derogatory comments. This incident follows the recent killing of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, sparking renewed unrest and political instability.

The probe has broadened beyond crowd control to suspected Rs 100 crore financial irregularities, including unaccounted cash for photos with Messi and opaque ticket sales, suggesting deliberate financial impropriety.

title: Court will always lean towards animals who suffer silently: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has signaled its strong inclination to protect elephants, stating it will always favor animals whose migration paths are obstructed by commercial tourism. This stance emerged during hearings concerning wildlife resorts in Tamil Nadu's Sigur Plateau elephant corridor. The court emphasized that any doubt regarding benefit should go to the silent victims of development.

Quote of the day by Sigmund Freud: 'A man should not strive to eliminate…'
description: Famous Austrian neurologist Sigmund Freud completely changed the way we look at the human mind by discovering psychoanalysis. It was a talking therapy for mental issues rooted in unconscious thoughts which people fail to realize and accept.  His  famous book "Interpretation of Dreams" said that dreams reveal hidden desires of human beings.
